official-title.#text:
To greatly enhance the Nation’s environmental, energy,
		  economic, and national security by terminating long-standing Federal
		  prohibitions on the domestic production of abundant offshore supplies of oil
		  and natural gas, and for other purposes.

short-title.#text:
Maximize Offshore Resource Exploration
			 Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Termination of
			 prohibitions on expenditures for, and withdrawals from, offshore oil and gas
			 leasing

text.#text:
All provisions
			 of Federal law that prohibit the expenditure of appropriated funds to conduct
			 oil and natural gas leasing and preleasing activities for any area of the Outer
			 Continental Shelf shall have no force or effect with respect to such
			 activities.

All withdrawals of Federal submerged lands of the
			 Outer Continental Shelf from leasing, including withdrawals by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, are hereby revoked and are no longer in effect with
			 respect to the leasing of areas for exploration for, and development and
			 production of, oil and natural gas.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 12(a) of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act

The Renewable Energy Reserve shall be

			 enactment of this Act—

to accelerate the

to promote the
			 utilization of energy-efficient products and practices; and

to increase research, development, and
			 deployment of clean renewable energy and efficiency technologies and job
			 training programs for those purposes.
